oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Pulsebeat Radio Show: Dean Dillon - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Kim Spangler (host) dictating the Pulsebeat section of the Voice of the Heartland Radio Show. The episode interviews Dean Dillon (musician). The episode was set to air for the week of October 03, 1988. The episode is part 1 of 2.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Kim Spangler; Dean Dillon
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:01) Kim Spangler introduces the upcoming Dean Dillon Pulsebeat show -- (00:35) Hey Heart (Dean Dillon) -- (03:32) Spangler introduces the commercial break -- (03:41) Dial 901 [unconfirmed] ([Unidentified]) -- (04:49) Spangler reveals Dean Dillon was performing on a television show by age fifteen; additionally, Dillon reflects on how his recording initially failed -- (06:03) Spangler and Dillon discuss how Dillon's party lifestyle had abruptly changed -- (07:34) Spangler reveals that Merle Haggard and being an extra at Opryland influenced Dillon -- (08:52) Go to Pieces (Dean Dillon) -- (12:12) Spangler introduces the commercial break -- (12:26) Spangler asks Dillon where the name 'Slick Nickel' came from -- (13:34) Father, Son and Holy Ghost (Dean Dillon) -- (17:25) Spangler and Dillon reflect on the difficulties of succeeding in music -- (18:18) Appalachia Got to Have You Feelin' in My Bones (Dean Dillon) -- (20:29) Spangler introduces the commercial break -- (20:49) Spangler asks Dillon what song he wished to hear -- (21:02) Baby Blue (George Strait) -- (24:14) Unidentified tune [featuring Kim Spangler outro discussion] ([Unidentified])
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Spangler, Kim; Dillon, Dean;
